This will be his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support received and commits to be punctual with his payments.  Jean will invest the 300 soles to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Washington Fernando

texts.es:
WASHINGTON tiene 28 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad, vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

WASHINGTON se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas,abonos,  polvillo, morocho. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la alimentación de los pollos y cerdos.

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Ventanas . El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para tener mayores ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Washington  is 28 years old. He is single and has an 8-month old child. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. He is a member of the "Genesis" Communal Bank, located in the rural community of Atascoso, in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this group carry out agricultural and livestock activities.
Washington grows corn and rice and raises poultry and pigs. He is asking for a loan to purchase urea, seeds, and fertilizer, for his crops, and an animal feed made from rice and a type of dense corn to feed his poultry and pigs. 
Washington makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. His biggest challenges are pests and plant disease in his crops. His dream is to buy a piece of land to increase his income. In his spare time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase urea, seeds, fertilizer, animal feed and a dense type of corn

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Don Julian, casado hace 12 años, tiene un hijo, el es oriundo del departamento de Tarija, persona de caracter ameno, trabajador, hogareño y sobre todo muy responsable. Hace 15 años atrás se vino al tropico en busca de una mejor calidad de vida, actualmente el vive en la población de Puerto Aurora. El empezo trabajando en los chacos del lugar con pagos jornales, y poco a poco fue ahorrando y se compro un terreno en dicha población, luego se compro un lote agricola donde el junto a su esposa se dedico a la producción de platano, el cuenta que ahora con la experiencia que adquirio quiere aumentar la producción y para eso necesita una motosierra para asi poder chaquear su lote agricola de manera mas eficiente, y de esa manera tener mejores ingresos y mejor la calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Don Julian has been married for 12 years and has one child. He is from the department of Tarija. He is by nature pleasant, hard-working, a homebody, and very responsible. Fifteen years ago he came to this area in search of a better life. He currently lives in Puerto Aurora. He started working on the local farms as a day labourer. Bit by bit he saved up and bought a piece of land in Puerto Aurora. He later bought a plot of agricultural land where he and his wife produce bananas. He tells us that now, with the experience he has acquired, he wants to increase his production. For this, he needs an electric saw to clear his land more efficiently. This way he will have a better income and a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Matha tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse al comercio de comida como la elaboración y venta de pupusas, almuerzos, etc. Y en la elaboración  de flores actividades que ha desarrollado durante varios años, oficio que aprendió de sus  padres. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos para preparar lo que venderán en el almuerzo. Luego, sus hijos se dirigen a la escuela, en la tarde prepara los ingredientes para elaborar pupusas lo que le genera ingresos para el sustento de su familia ya que ella, es padre y madre para todos sus hijos

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar lámina y cambiar el techo de su casa ya que se le moja y ampliar la acera de su casa, debido a que ahí atiende a sus clientes mientras están consumiendo sus alimentos. Con el mejoramiento de su vivienda atraerá más clientes para su negocio lo que le generara mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia

Ella planea en un futuro darles una educación universitaria a sus hijos y que lleguen hacer profesionales.
texts.en:
Matha is 58. She is a single mother of six. For several years she has made and sold food, including pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans], lunches, etc. She has also sold flowers for several years. She learned her work from her parents. She gets up at 5:00 am with her children to prepare the food that she will sell at lunch time. Later, her children go to school. In the afternoons, she prepares the ingredients for making pupusas. This generates an income to support her family; she is both father and mother to all her children.
This loan, which she is requesting from Fundación Campo, is for the purchase of laminate and to change the leaky roof in her home. She will also expand the paved area where her customers eat. With this improvement to her home, she will attract more customers, and this will generate her more income to sustain her family.
In the future she plans to provide her children with a university education and to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy laminate and to change her home's leaky roof, and to expand the paving.

loans.name: Lidia Nohemy

texts.es: Lidia de 43 años de edad  vive con sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más. Ella es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. lidia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias. lidia es una madre de familia muy responsable quien desea mucho poder brindarle todo lo mejor para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en: Lidia, age 43, lives with her two children. She has a store where she sells basic staples such as bread, milk, eggs, canned goods, bottled water, and vegetables. She is a very responsible and kind person who has many clients even though she does not have a great variety of products. Lidia is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy a higher quantity of products. Her greatest desire is to be able to stock her business and have a greater income. Lidia is a mother and is very responsible. She very much wants to be able to provide all the best so that her children can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, candy, oil, pop, water, etc.

loans.name: Marina Concepcion

texts.es: Marina de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar, marina desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Marina, 43, lives in her own house with her family; she sells tortillas.  She makes them every midday and night.  Her business is located at home.  

Martina would very much like to be able to improve the business because it produces very stable profits that allow her to support her family which is why she’s asking for a loan by which to be able to buy corn at wholesale and lime powder to make more tortillas especially on weekends which is when demand rises because many of the other tortilla shops are closed.  

She will be able to earn higher profits this way that will make it possible for her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder at wholesale.

loans.name: Ngak's Group

texts.en:
Ngak, a rural villager in Siem Reap Province’s Srey Snom district, is 30 years old and a mother of three children, all of whom are in school. To meet family expenses, she has been growing rice for five years, earning about 10,000 KHR per day.

Ngak has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three loans, all of which have helped improve her living conditions and all of which she has repaid. Now Ngak is leading her group of four to request a new loan, her portion of which she will use to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las palmeras se encuentra trabajando y este es su ciclo 9, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les sirve para conocer la situación de pobreza de cada una, para que así por medio de las capacitaciones puedan ir mejorando.
Una persona a destacar por su esfuerzo y su trabajo es la Sra. Olga, quien además de ser miembro, también es la presidenta del grupo, tratando siempre de apoyar a sus compañeras. Su labor también es la venta de ropas de todo tipo, siempre tiene muy buena variedad y es por eso que sus clientes siempre la prefieren.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de abrigos, buzos, camperas, bufandas y demás, ya que se acerca la época de frío y quiere poder tener una buena variedad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Las Palmeras group is in its ninth cycle. The members are currently carrying out an inquest into the elimination of poverty in order to know the situation of each one of the women. This way, through training, they will be able to improve.
One person who should be highlighted for her hard work is Olga. She is not just a member; she is the group president and always tries to support her groupmates. She sells all varieties of clothing and always has a very good variety; this is why her customers always prefer her business.
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of coats, sweaters, jackets, scarves, and more. The cold season is coming up and she wants to be able to have a good variety of garments to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy coats, sweaters, jackets, scarves, and more.

loans.name: Sigei

texts.en:
Sigei, who lives in the Litein area of Kenya, is the father of six children and has been a farmer for 11 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. The high cost of farming is his biggest challenge. School fees are his highest monthly expense.

Sigei chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the good training it offers. He will use the loan to purchase poultry.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sigei owns a cow and poultry. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, nor a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home. She is well-known in the area for her humility and her work ethic. She has never given up and has always overcome her difficulties. With hard work and dedication, she owns a store where she sells basic staples such as milk, eggs, and rice. She is very dedicated to her job and provides very good service. For this reason, she has customers who seek her out and prefer her products. She has found it necessary to stock her store a bit more because of an increase in demand. She does not have the capital to do so, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products such as instant products, candy, drinks, etc. She trusts God that she will soon receive this help and be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic staples such as instant products, candy, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, Ana se dedica vender embutidos (mortadelas, jamón y salchichas) con la ayuda de su esposo vende en las diferentes tiendas y negocios de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar embutidos por mayor y así seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, lives with her husband and two children who are 15 and 10 years of age and attending school at the moment.  Ana sells cured meats (mortadella, ham and sausages) with her husband’s help; she sells to various stores and businesses in her place of residence and uses profits earned to help cover some of her household expenses. 

Ana’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to buy cured meats at wholesale to stay in business since this is her only source of work to be able to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy cured meats at wholesale.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 55 años  de edad desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y ajonjolí con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Tomás, 55, has worked in agriculture for many years; it’s his main source of income.  He grows corn and sesame and uses profits earned from his harvests to cover some of his household expenses.  He wants to buy the supplies he needs for his crops like manure, fertilizer and seeds and to improve the land where he does his planting and that’s shown in the photo.  

However, noting that he does not have the economic resources needed for said investment he’s decided to request a loan since only in this way will he be able to continue with his farming project.  Like all other farmers, he places his trust in agriculture because they have no other source of income and he wants to improve doing the best he can for his crops.  He hopes to obtain an abundant harvest that will make it possible for him to continue providing daily bread for his home and to repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to improve his land.

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesús

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura  desde que tenia 13 años de edad,  su papá la llevaba a que le ayudara y le decía que aprendiera a trabajar pues le iba a servir cuando tuviera su hogar.  Luego se acompaño  y le fue mal, después encontró un gran hombre con el que se caso. Ella también le ayuda en la agricultura y además le gusta el comercio  y la venta, ella también vende pescado  y le gusta el negocio  de ropa, aunque es muy sacrificado la vida de ella, pues tiene que levantarse a las 4:30 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno  a su esposo y luego prepara a sus niños para la escuela, posteriormente se va a vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 galones de herbicidas para controlar la maleza, una bolsa de semilla, 8 sacos de abono. Con la inversión, sembrara maíz la tierra ya la tiene preparada pero necesita comprar los insumos. 

Ella  sueña con poder comprar un solar y construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que vive en  lo ajeno y en una casa de láminas.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 38, is married and has four children.  She’s been working in agriculture since she was 13-years-old; her father would take her along to help him and would tell her that she needed to learn to work because that would be useful when she had her own home.  

Later she took up with someone but it wasn’t good but after that she met a good man that she married.  She helps him with the agriculture and she also likes commerce; she sells fish and also likes the clothing business even though her life is very demanding because she must rise at 4:30 in the morning to prepare her husband’s breakfast and then get her children ready for school and after that head out to sell.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy two gallons of herbicide to control weeds, a bag of seeds and 8 sacks of manure.  With this investment she will plant corn.  She’s already prepared the soil but needs to buy the supplies.  She dreams with being able to buy a piece of land to build a brick house since she currently lives in a house that is of metal sheeting on land that doesn’t belong to her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
Lesli tiene una edad de 32 años es una mujer feliz mente casada y madre de 2 hijos con un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico brindado por sus padres. El esposo de ella es maestro de educación primaria y agricultor y también trabaja la caficultura en sus horas no laborales. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia el rubro de la agricultura especialmente el cultivo de café es una tradición y su único medio de ingreso económico para el sustento familiar.

Ella ha decidido inyectarle un poco de capital a sus cultivos de café por medio de un financiamiento por medio de la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos que protegerán su cosecha de los cambios climáticos, plagas entre otros como, el gramoxon, fertilizantes, abono, urea entre otros.

Sus planes a corto plazo es lograr incrementar el volumen de producción de café el cual pueda traer más ingresos para su familia y de esa forma poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y seguir formando un patrimonio para su bienestar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Lesli is 32 years old. She is happily married and has two children. She finished her primary education thanks to the financial support from her parents. Her husband works as a primary education teacher and also as a farmer in the coffee plantation in his spare time. Lesli learned from her parents how to farm the land at a very early age. In her family, farming, and coffee farming in particular, is a tradition and their only source of income.
Lesli has decided to inject some capital to her coffee plantation with the support from the field partner, "Cooperativa Comixmul". With the loan, she will buy supplies that will protect her crops from weather changes, pesticides such as "gramoxon", chemical fertilizers, manure, urea, etc. Lesli's short term goals include increasing the coffee production volume to bring more income home. In that way she hopes to support her children with their studies as well as establish some assets for their well-being in the future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 47 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Todas las mañanas desde hace 18 años, se despierta muy contenta; pues le gusta atender su pequeña tienda de productos comestibles tales como arroz, harinas, cafe, azúcar, entre otros. Nelly es muy conocida en su zona, porqué todo los sábados y domingos se dirige a la ciudad a comprar los productos que venderá en su tienda durante la semana. Ella es la única que abastece su zona con productos alimenticios, por ello le va muy bien en su negocio. Con el pasar de los años, Nelly equipó su tienda con carnes, azúcar, arroz y ahora quiere adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los habitantes. Además tiene una tienda de fertilizantes naturales donde aprovecha para vender a los agricultores de su zona. Asimismo su esposo José se dedica al trasporte público con el auto que adquirieron hace poco; con ello obtienen un dinero extra para el hogar su hogar.  Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nelly, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de comestibles para surtir su tienda de comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, leche y demás.
texts.en:
Nelly, 47, is married and has four children but only two of them still live at home with her in her own house.  Every morning for the last 18 years she wakes up very happy because she likes tending to her small grocery store where she sells such things as rice, flour, coffee and sugar, among others.  Nelly is very well-known in the zone because heads to the city every Saturday and Sunday to buy the products she’ll sell in her store during the week.  

She’s the only one in her zone that stocks her store with food items which is why she does very well in her business.  As years have passed, Nelly has stocked her store with meats, sugar and rice and now wants to acquire still more products to meet the residents’ needs. She also has a natural fertilizers store where she sells to local farmers. Her husband, José, works in public transportation with the car they acquired a short time ago and earn extra income with it for their home.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support received; she commits to make her payments punctually. Nelly will use the money to buy food items like rice, sugar, milk and others to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene 23 años,  tiene el oficio de tornero tiene su taller en la localidad de El Torno de la  ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia  dentro de la institución, El Sr. Edwin  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una prensa hidráulica para su negocio ya que le facilitara realizar su trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Edwin  va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de herramientas y materiales, El Sr. Edwin  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada,  su deseo es poder incrementar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edwin, 23, works as a lathe operator in his workshop located in the El Torno neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution.  Edwin will use this loan to buy a hydraulic press for his business since it will make his work easier.  His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his business.  Edwin will use profits to continue buying a variety of tools and  materials.  Edwin is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity provided.  His wish is to be able to increase his clientele and thus his income and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a hydraulic press.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia is a hardworking mother of one child. Her husband works as a private worker. Because of her child, Mia wants to add some additional income for her family, and joining RUMA was one of the ways to do this. Since she joined RUMA three months ago, her revenue per day has reached USD 50-55. So she wants to increase this to help her family have a higher income.

Working capital loans to Ruma agents allow them to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions. Each Ruma agent has a balance with Ruma that allows them to sell mobile phone credit or process bill payments.  When the balance is at zero, the agent cannot process any additional sales or bill payments and has to top up their balance by giving Ruma field officers cash in exchange for electronic credit. 

For operational efficiency, Ruma can collect from agents only as frequently as once a day and cannot collect on the weekend when banks are closed and cash can't be safely deposited there.  As a result, agents often have lower sales on the weekend and have unfulfilled potential to make more transactions during weekdays when their balances are empty.  

This working capital loan allows credit-worthy borrowers to reach their full sales potential. The loan is structured like a line of credit that the borrower uses and repays as needed during the loan term.  At the end of the term, the borrower is responsible for paying back any outstanding balance so that the total amount can be returned to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Asdreyno

texts.es: Asdreyno  de 36 años de edad habita con su cónyuge en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, lugar donde hace 3 años, naciera la idea de emprender por si mismo una actividad comercial, como la venta de ropa, perfumería y medicamentos naturales, ensayo comercial mediante el cual le fue muy bien y aun continua trabajando en ella, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, con el fin de generar ingresos y contribuir con el bienestar de su hogar, porque su sueño mas adelante, es hacer mejoramientos a su vivienda y ubicarse en un local estratégico para el comercio de los productos que vende, pues hoy trabaja voz a voz y mediante encargos o pedidos que hacen sus clientes, entre los que se cuentan sus amigos y conocidos. En la actualidad Asdreyno está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará medicamentos naturales especialmente,  para con esta inversión  finalmente,  lograr que su negocio sea mucho mas rentable y es que este es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Asdreyno is 36 years old and lives with his spouse in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias. 3 years ago he had the idea to start up a business selling clothes, perfumes and natural medicine products. His business has been successful and he works from 8 am to 8 pm to generate income and contribute to the household's well-being. His dream in the future is to make improvements to his home and find strategically located premises to sell his products. For the time being, he sells his merchandise by word of mouth and by customer order. Among his customers are friends and acquaintances.
Asdreyno is applying for his first loan with Kiva, through the field partner, "Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo". With the money from the loan, he will purchase natural medicine products. This investment will finally make his business much more profitable and will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicine products

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas desde hace 5 años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios muy cómodos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo   logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, lucia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Lucia lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has been selling underclothes for women for five years. She has the business in her home, and she has many customers because her products are of very good quality and at very affordable prices. With the money she makes from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they pay for household expenses. Lucia is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise wholesale to continue with her business and be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: purchase clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Yenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Yenny, es una joven madre con una hija, es casada, trabaja en el sector de la educación como docente en un colegio público, profesión que no es bien pagado en Nicaragua, por lo que Yenny también estudia la carrera de Química y Farmacia, gastos que cubre con su salario mensual. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación y postgrado de su carrera, una de sus principales metas en la vida porque le interesa mucho su profesión, para aspirar a un mejor desarrollo económico que beneficie a su familia.
texts.en:
Yenny is a young, married mother of one daughter. She works in the education sector as a teacher in a public school, a job which is not well paid in Nicaragua. As such, Yenny is also studying chemistry and pharmacy, which she pays for with her monthly salary. 

She is requesting a loan in order to pay for graduate studies, an important goal in her life, as she is passionate about her profession and aspires to a better financial situation for her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for graduate studies.

loans.name: Chara

texts.en:
Chara is a hardworking man for his family and children. He has two children; the older child is 14 years old and the younger is 9 years old. Chara sells mobile phone credit to his co-workers at his chemical company. Now he has almost 50 partners, and the business is still growing. He wants to focus on this mobile phone credit business.

Working capital loans to Ruma agents allow them to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions. Each Ruma agent has a balance with Ruma that allows them to sell mobile phone credit or process bill payments. When the balance is at zero, the agent cannot process any additional sales or bill payments and has to top up their balance by giving Ruma field officers cash in exchange for electronic credit.  

For operational efficiency, Ruma can collect from agents only as frequently as once a day and cannot collect on the weekend when banks are closed, and cash can't be safely deposited there. As a result, agents often have lower sales on the weekend and have unfulfilled potential to make more transactions during weekdays when their balances are empty.  

This working capital loan allows credit-worthy borrowers to reach their full sales potential. The loan is structured like a line of credit that the borrower uses and repays as needed during the loan term. At the end of the term, the borrower is responsible for paying back any outstanding balance so that the total amount can be returned to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: San Jose Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Jose Obrero” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad con difícil acceso a los medios de comunicación. La mayoría de las integrantes son de las colonias de los alrededores.
La Sra. Gessica es peluquera y también tiene un copetín, como se puede ver es una persona muy trabajadora y que siempre se encuentra cargada de mucho trabajo, ella está luchando por su familia, para poder darles lo que ella no pudo tener. También nos dice que sueña con que su colonia crezca y que tenga una mayor seguridad para los habitantes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería y también para su copetín, los cuales son sus fuentes de ingreso principales.
texts.en:
The San Jose Obrero committee formed with the coming-together of several neighbors in the city of Santani, a city with low access to communication means. The majority of the members are from the surrounding colonies.

Gessica is a hairdresser, and she also has a fast-food stall. You can see her as a very hardworking person, and she always finds herself with plenty of work. She is fighting for her family, to be able to give them what she could not have. She also tells us that she dreams of her colony growing and that there will be better security for the residents.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her hairdresser shop and also for her fast-food stall, which are her main sources of income.

loans.use: purchase supplies for hairdressing and a fast-food stall

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en: Chausiku lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She sells doughnuts in the nearby market everyday. She plans to open a retail shop and that's why she came to Kiva lenders to help her achieve this dream. She wants to buy retail items like sugar, flour, cooking fat, and rice to start a shop. The extra income from this loan will enable her to plough back profits until the business is stable enough. She wants a better life for herself and her family. She is a married woman blessed with four children. She learned about Milango through friends and the major challenges that she anticipates is inflation and price changes.

loans.use: To buy retail items like sugar, flour, cooking fat and rice.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as optimistic and focused. She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank, which will benefit the six members of her family. This will ensure they store enough clean water for use. Her source of income is selling milk. She faces a challenge of competition from other sellers in this business. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to sustain her family economically and get financial freedom. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Orn is 48 years old. She has a spouse and three children .For over 13 years, Orn and her husband have been involved in farming and fishing as their primary source of income. The income they make usually goes for food and home bills.  

She has asked for a loan to buy a cow to breed and to help her with the maintenance of the paddy fields. This can be a kind of long investment for her but hopefully, it will provide a good profit a year later. She would like to express her thankfulness to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed and to pay for the maintenance of the paddy fields

loans.name: Ma-Nyanly

texts.en:
Please meet 45-year-old Ma-Nyanly, from Paynesville North, in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round-time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Ma-Nyanly has obtained a university degree and she is married. She describes herself as a hard-working businesswoman. Her husband is a businessman.

Ma-Nyanly has a shop in which she sells lappa (traditional cloths, mostly used by African women) and African dresses. She has been in this business for 14 years and she works 12 hours each day at her business.  

With this loan, she will buy lappa and dresses for her business. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is few goods in her shop. She transports her goods by bus. She started her business with money from her husband, who sells gasoline.  

Ma-Nyanly is proud of her business because she makes more profit. Her plans are to build a house and to buy her car. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy lappa and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 36-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five-children. Her husband owns a general store in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of products in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to his lack of capital, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Haleema has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase a variety of products to sell n the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Haleema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Margara

texts.es:
Margara continua  viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani, sigue con la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria y con la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y chanchos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y chanchos. 

Margara continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Su sueño es hacer crecer el negocio y tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Margara continues living in the city of Huancarani. She continues selling food as a street vendor. She also sells small animals, such as for example guinea pigs and pigs. She has had these businesses for several years and she has been doing very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. At this time she needs a loan to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

Margara continues as a member of the “Mamacha Rosario” communal bank in Asociación Araiwa and she is grateful for the opportunity provided her in this way. Thus she is committed to making her payments on time. Her dream is to expand her business and to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedora de éxitos una de ellas es Marvel mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera y su negocio es la artesanía en madera, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan en el negocio con salario, el objetivo del préstamo es para adquirir materia prima como madera, pinturas, clavos, adornos etc. Digna tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es de un taller de bordados y María tiene 48 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cajetas.
texts.en:
The group is formed by three successful entrepreneurial partners. One woman, Marvel, is 31 years old and unmarried. Her business is woodwork which she has been doing for 4 years. She works with two people who help her with her business and to whom she pays a salary. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase raw materials such as wood, paint, nails, ornaments, etc. Digna is 57 years old and owns an embroidery shop, and Maria is 48 and sells caramels.

loans.use: to invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, paint, nails, ornaments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a lot of fish as well as chicken

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, desde hace 4 años se decidió por trabajar en la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y sorgo, comercializa sus productos en las zonas aledañas de donde reside  con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con sus cosechas como: fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: The borrower lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. Four years ago, she decided to work in farming. Her main crops are corn and sorghum. She sells her products in the areas surrounding where she lives. With the money she makes from her sales, she covers some of the household expenses. The borrower is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the necessary supplies to continue with her harvests, such as fertilizers, compost, herbicides, seeds, etc., and to improve the land where she plants, which is shown in the photo, in order to generate better revenues and giver her family better financial stability.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, compost, herbicides, seeds, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson, de 25 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Angélica y su hija, pero muy pronto tendrán la llegada de un integrante a su familia, pues su esposa está embarazada. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada desde hace 5 años. Wilson se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, los cuales labra con mucho esmero, pues de su trabajo depende el ingreso económico de su hogar. Comenta que la fábrica lo comparte con su cuñado, pues tiene una sociedad y trabajan juntos. “Mi principal ingreso económico se centra en vender los millares de ladrillos a empresa y gobernaciones, de esa forma obtengo más ganancias y puedo vender mayor cantidad”, comenta. En todo este tiempo tuvo mucha competencia, por lo que la arena del lugar terminará dentro de unos años más, es así que quiere comenzar con la crianza de vacas e intensificar su crianza para cuando deje de fabricar ladrillos. Este es su segundo crédito con kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindan, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Wilson, invertirá los 4,500 soles en la compra de madera y otros productos para continuar con la fabricación de ladrillos, pues desea aprovechar la temporada de sol para fabricar más ladrillos.
texts.en:
Wilson, 25 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife, Angélica and his daughter, however very soon another member of the family will arrive because his wife is pregnant. They have been living in a rented house for five years. Wilson painstakingly makes bricks, a business on which he depends for household income. He notes that he makes them with his brother-in-law, since they have a partnership and work together.

“My principal source of income centers on selling thousands of bricks to businesses and government units. In this way I make more profits and can sell in larger quantities,” he states. In all this time he has had a lot of competition because the sand in the area will be exhausted within a few years. That is why he wants to begin raising cows and to increase their numbers for the time when he has to stop producing bricks. 

This is his second loan from Kivá and he is grateful for the support provided him so that he will be able to continue investing in the progress of his business. In addition he is committed to being punctual in re-paying his loan. Wilson will invest the S/. 4,500 in the purchase of wood and other products in order to continue producing bricks because he wants to make  the most  of the sunny season to make more bricks.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other products to make bricks.

loans.name: Ruben Cesar

texts.es: El señor Ruben es un joven trabajador, curso hasta concluir el bachillerato ya que por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; de estado civil soltero tiene gran experiencia en el rubro de la construcción civil ya que lleva más de 8 años en esta actividad; hoy solicita el presente crédito para poder reparar el motor del vehículo con el cual trabaja para el traslado de sus herramientas de trabajo hacia los lugares que este debe trasladarse, y así poder seguir en la actividad que lleva trabajando, ya que con el crédito que se le otorgue le ayudara a cumplir uno de sus sueños que es poder contar con una casa propia para así formar una familia que es lo que más anhela. Actualmente el señor Ruben vive en alquiler, cuenta con un vehículo que es su único patrimonio, herramienta de trabajo que le facilita en las labores que este desempeña.
texts.en: Ruben is a young worker. He completed his bachelor's studies, but because of financial issues, he did not pursue higher studies. Seeing the need to look for work, he put his schooling to the side. He is single and has great experience in the field of civil construction; he has more than eight years in this business. He is requesting a loan to be able to repair the engine of the vehicle he uses to transport his work tools to the places they should go so he can continue working. The authorized loan will help him reach one of his dreams, which is to be able to have his own home so he can start a family, which is what he most wants. Currently, Ruben lives in a rental. He has a vehicle, which is his only inheritance, and work tools that facilitate his work.

loans.use: repair the engine of the vehicle that he uses to transport his construction tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Cesar Wilfrido

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes
 
Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y comprar una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta fútbol con los amigos.
texts.en:
Cesar is 24 years old and unmarried. He does not have children and lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios Province.

He belongs to Genesis Communal Bank, which is located in the Atascoso area. The area is part of Ventana canton and members of the bank engage in farming and livestock.

Cesar farms corn and rice. He is applying for a loan to purchase urea, seeds, compost and fertilizer. With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase fertilizer.

He makes his purchases and sales in Guaranda. The challenges that confront him are pests and plant sicknesses.

His dream is to purchase land so that he can continue planting and buy a house. In his free time he enjoys soccer with his friends.

loans.use: to purchase urea, seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: El señor Teofilo, tiene 29 años, soltero, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. El es oriundo de la Provincia de Quillacollo, donde vivía junto a su madre, fue huérfano de padre desde muy pequeño. Hace seis años atrás vino a radicar al trópico de Cochabamba, en busca de mejor vida, empezó trabajando en los chacos, con pagos jornales y poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia en la producción de plátano, banano y papaya. Recientemente con los ahorros que tenia y el apoyo de su madre se compro un chaco donde empezó a cultivar plátano; actualmente cuenta con dos hectáreas de producción. También adquirió un lote urbano donde vive actualmente, ahora el solicita el crédito para refaccionar la vivienda donde el vive y así poder traer a su mama para vivir junto a él.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 29 years old and is unmarried. He is a very responsible person and hard worker. He is a native of the Province of Quillacollo where he lives with his mother. He hasn't seen his father since he was little. 

Six years ago he went to live in the tropic of Cochabamba in search of a better life. He began working in Los Chacos. With the payments of daily wages; little by little he began gaining experience in the production of plantain, banana and papaya. Recently, with his savings and the support of his mother, he bought a farm where he began cultivating plantain. Now, he has two hectares of production. Also he bought an urban lot where he lives at the moment. 

Now, he is requesting a loan to repair the house where he lives and thus be able to bring his mother to live with him.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Chou's Group

texts.en:
Chou, 25, is a married mother of one child who is too young for school. She has been farming rice as the main source of her family's income in a village in the Srey Snom District of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been in this business for five years, earning a daily income of around 10,000 KHR.

Chou's group consists of four members who live in the same village, and she is in her second cycle while the other members are first-time client with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Her first loan helped her to support her family. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 47-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Since 2009, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family.Due to an increase in customer demand, Hameeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He will also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Please meet Catherine, 35, from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

She has obtained a university degree and she is unmarried. She describes herself as a hardworking and intelligent person. Her fiancee is a government employee. They have two children, aged 15 and 8, who are in school and live at home.

Catherine has a shop which sells children clothes such as trousers, jeans, dresses, blouses, T-shirts and other items. She has been in this business for sixteen years and works 9 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy more inventory for her business.  One of the greatest challenges that he faces is a lack of inventory in her shop. She transports her goods by bus. She started this business with money from her fiancee. She is proud of her business because she makes more profit. Her plans are to own a house and educate her children. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy trousers, jeans, dresses, blouses, T-shirts and other items for her business.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Ilkin is 29 years old. He is a very hardworking and dedicated young man. He is married and has two children, six and four years old. He works at a construction site as a foreman. Due to his work, two years ago Ilkin bought a dairy cow and began an agricultural business. Now he sells dairy products and animals for meat. Ilkin dreams of finishing the building of his home and moving to live in his own house. He applied for a loan in order to buy a gate and fence for the home's yard.

loans.use: To buy a gate and fence for his home's yard.

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Soth, aged 39, works hard to support her family. She has been operating a bread vending business in a market of her region. She has a big bamboo basket full of bread to sell from the morning until the afternoon. She is able to make a net profit of $5.00 per day on average. 

Soth is borrowing a loan amounting to 1,200 US dollars to make home improvements; so that she can protect her family from the weather conditions. This will be her second loan from HKL as her previous helped her improve the general living conditions. In the future, Soth plans to look for a sustainable and viable business and she will save money for that.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en: Aashi is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Aashi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Aashi is very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 33 years old and a housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. 
Fozia has requested a loan of 22,000 PKR (Pakistani rupee) from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking this loan for her husband to buy welding material such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rods, iron sheets, etc. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase welding material

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is an Iraqi client, who is 33 years old and lives with his parents and his brother. Haydar, his father and his brother take care of the family income.

Haydar is a grocer. In his grocery store, he sells canned food, dairy products, soft drinks and detergents. He has been in this field since 2010. He gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Haydar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to buy a new refrigerator, an air conditioner and to renovate his grocery store. He believes that this loan will positively affect and improve his financial condition.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator, an air conditioner and to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un, 47, is married with four children. She has a business position in a local market, selling flowers and eggs, making a net profit about $5.00 each day. She wants to sells a variety of products to earn more, but her rented booth is small. She mentioned that she will expand her business one day and have her clients buy more products from her. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She has requested a 500 USD loan to purchase additional flowers and eggs for her small store. She hopes that the loan will enable her have profitable sales and thereby secure the welfare of her family. In the future, she wants to save to expand her business and save for future family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional flowers and eggs for her small store.

loans.name: Roeub

texts.en:
Residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Roeub is a mother of four children and is 38 years old. 

Two of her kids are in school while the other two are too young for school. To overcome her daily costs, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland. In her current business, she can earn about 20,500 KHR per day for her family’s need.

She has successfully paid back her past five loans with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and this loan has allowed her family to have better living conditions. Now she is applying for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase her income to keep her children in school and save some money for her family needs.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia, 29, is a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and 2 children. Her husband has run a business selling gem stone for 3 years. He has a shop in the market. Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the loan, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This will attract more customers and increase his sales. After getting the profit, Sobia will pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rare gem stones.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: Parveen is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen, as a member of a three-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Bwanda Bakyala Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
Boaz is 37 years old, married and is a Ugandan citizen who lives in Bwanda, Buhunga, Rukungiri District. He is an agriculturalist who grows tomatoes in the same area where he lives. He has two children' one is 6 months old and the other is 2 years old; therefore, none of them is in school. 

Boaz’s current business is an inheritance from his father, who is now 90. His father lives with him and has outgrown the age of digging. The son therefore decided to continue with the business to earn income to take care of his family and his aged father, who needs intensive care that suits his old age. 

Boaz therefore applied for a group loan with Bwanda Bakyara Kwetungura Group in order to improve his agricultural business to a standard that can match his requirements through mulching and manuring the tomatoes. The main challenge he is facing now is weather; there is a lot of sunshine which necessitates him to water the tomatoes, thus making it more expensive for him to meet his target of being the chief supplier of Rukungiri district by the end of the year.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is a 35-year-old woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one daughter. She has been doing business selling school bags for 13 years. Her sales have been increasing with time. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will purchase a new variety of school bags so that her sales and net income will increase. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of school bags

loans.name: Domingo Taile

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en casa arrendada en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Domingo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y tener mas ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta fútbol y y caminar con el padre por los terrenos.
texts.en:
Domingo is a 19 year old single man with no children. He lives with his parents in a rented house in the city of Ventana in Los Rios province.

He belongs to the VRC GENESIS which is located in a miry area. It belongs to the Ventanas district which is dedicated to livestock and agricultural work.

Domingo works as a farmer and plants corn and rice. He is seeking this loan in order to buy urea, seeds, manure and fertilizer. With the help of the loan he will be able to purchase fertilizer and a pump to spray the plots for insects.

He will carry out his purchases and sales in Guaranda. The challenges he is facing include pests and diseases in the crops.

His dream is to buy land in order to seed more crops and obtain a higher income. In his free time he likes to play soccer and walk in the fields with his father.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Chunry

texts.en: At age 25, Chunry is married with two children, both of whom are too young for school. He makes a living through his rice plantation on four hectares of farmland. He has been in this business for eight years. This is the third microloan for him with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The past loan has gradually improved his living condition. As the result, he can earn about 17,300 KHR per day. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy a hand tractor for his farm. He hopes to grow rice timely and get a high crop yield.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Sari is 63 years old and a father of five children. He lives in Battambang province. He is a farmer who grows rice on five hectares of farmland. Sari has been growing rice for 40 years to make a living. He earns about 21,100 KHR per day. He has never been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. Now he is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. He will spend his loan portion to plow his farmland. He hopes that he can make a huge income from his business to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To plow his farmland

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, 55, is a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a barber shop for three years. Due to an increase in customers, he wants to expand his business. 

For this purpose, Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her husband would purchase new chairs for his shop as well as razors, blades, shaving creams, hair dryers, etc. These purchases would increase his earnings and net income. 

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, hair dryers, razors, etc., for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kilifi, Kenya. For the last nine years, she has sold clothes for a living. Her major challenges are competition from other businesses, price fluctuations and inflation.

Victoria knew about Milango Financial Services through friends and, since she was in need of credit, she joined. She now seeks a loan to buy an additional five bales of clothes for resale. 

The extra income she earns from the loan will go toward paying her children’s school fees. In the next five years, she wants to open more outlets, where she will employ people.

loans.use: to buy an additional five bales of clothes

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida, 35, is educated, well-mannered and the responsible mother of one child. Her husband works in a government organization. For a better future for her son, Rashida sells ladies’ shoes part time from her house.

Rashida has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to open a shop in the market to run her business properly. She is not getting enough customers by selling from her house. 

With this loan, she would purchase a variety of shoes and, in this way, expand her business. With her profits, she would send her son to the best school in town. 

Rashida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of shoes to sell

loans.name: Neofita

texts.es: Neófita tiene  41 años, está casada y vive en casa propia construida a base de adobe junto su esposo y sus dos hijos. Neófita estaba delicada de salud hace unos años, por esta razón abrió una tienda de productos comestibles. No obstante al recuperarse decidió retomar su trabajo en el campo en donde hasta hoy produce cacao y café entre otros productos más comerciales de su localidad. Para obtener una calidad comercial de sus productos cuida el suelo de sus terrenos con abono orgánico y para facilitar su trabajo también contrata trabajadores, quienes le ayudan en el proceso de siembra. Uno de sus principales objetivos es ampliar su tienda de productos comestibles y producir más con sus terrenos agrícolas. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y espera seguir contando con su apoyo financiero y así seguir adelante. Con el monto de 1,000 nuevos soles comprara  abono orgánico para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Neófita is 41 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in a house they own, which is made of adobe. Several years ago, Neófita was in delicate health and because of this she opened a food store. Nevertheless when she got better she decided to go back to work in the fields where she has been cultivating cacao and coffee, among other more commercial crops in the area. 

In order to obtain commercial grade crops she treats her land with organic fertilizer and to facilitate her work she also contracts workers who help her with the sowing process. One of her principal objectives is to expand her food store and to increase productivity on her farmland. 

This is her second loan from Kiva and she hopes to continue having its financial support so that she can continue progressing. With the sum of S/. 1,000 she will buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde continua realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de combustible y venta de artefactos como por ejemplo radios, televisores, planchas y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería ósea gasolina y petróleo. Victoria continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria still lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo where she continues selling a variety of items. She continues selling fuel, as well as gadgets, such as radios, televisions, irons and other things. She has had this business for several years and she has been doing well thanks to the determination she brings to her work.

Victoria needs a loan at this time in order to purchase merchandise, that is to say, gasoline and oil. She continues being a member of "Mamacha Rosario" Communal Bank in Asociación Arariwa and she is grateful for the opportunity provided to her. She is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and oil.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin  de 43 años de edad, desde hace 3 años, tiene un negocio, el cual inició cuando pensando en generar ingresos, se dio cuenta que actividades similares a la que realizaría, daban buenos resultados. Por eso desde el año 2009 inició su pequeña refresquería y hoy con su esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido prosperando. Sus ventas las realiza directamente al consumidos final y las hace a crédito y de contado, desde los jueves a los domingos y días feriados, en el horario desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 de la noche.  Las compras las realiza directamente a los camiones de reparto y sus principales clientes son los vecinos del sector, a quienes les place consumir estas bebidas muy frías, para refrescarse del incesante calor del caribe Colombiano. Su meta mas adelante es lograr ahorrar para establecerse en un lugar de mayor amplitud, para generar más ingresos y apoyar aun mas el bienestar de sus hijos brindándoles una educación de calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará canastas de refrescos, especialmente gaseosas. Su credikiva le da la posibilidad de realizar compras en mayor escala, porque cuenta con un mayor capital y esto es lo que hace de esta inversión un total éxito.
texts.en: Franklin is 43 years old and has had his business for three years. He started it when he was thinking about a way to earn income and realized he could do this work and achieve good results. So in 2009 he started his small refreshment stand, and today, with a lot of hard work and dedication he has been able to prosper. He sells directly to customers on cash and credit from Thursday to Sunday and on holidays. His schedule is from 8 a.m. until midnight. He makes his purchases directly from delivery trucks, and his main customers are his neighbors, who enjoy very cold beverages to cool themselves from the incessant heat of the Colombian Caribbean. His goal for the future is to save so he can establish a bigger place for his business in order to generate more income and to better support his children and provide them with a quality education. He is requesting a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase baskets of refreshments, especially soft drinks. The loan will give him the ability to make purchases on a bigger scale since he will have more capital, and that will make this investment a success.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, especially soft drinks.

loans.name: Octavia Angelica

texts.es: Octavia tiene 39 años, está casada, y vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe junto su esposo y sus dos hijos. Octavia se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno que compró hace 20 años. Desde que empezó a trabajar en el campo ha logrado salir adelante gracias a la venta de los granos secos. Sin embargo para lograr una buena calidad de sus productos debe brindarle a sus cultivos un buen mantenimiento constante retirando la maleza y fertilizando el suelo de sus terrenos con abono orgánico. Cuando hay mucho trabajo contrata a trabajadores para que le ayuden a cambio de un salario diario. Octavia desea con el tiempo comprar su propio vehículo para facilitar el transporte de sus productos. Con el monto de 3,000 nuevos soles comprara abono orgánico y plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Octavia is 39 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children in a house they own, which is made of adobe. Octavia has been farming on land she bought twenty years ago. Since she started to work in the fields she has been successful thanks to selling  basic grains. Nevertheless in order to have good quality crops she needs to maintain her fields by constantly weeding them and fertilizing the soil with organic compost. When there is a lot of work, she contracts workers to help her and pays them every day.

In time, Octavia wants to purchase her own vehicle so she can transport her products more easily. With the sum of S/. 3,000, she will purchase organic compost and cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost and cacao plants.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is very a diligent and hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a gold shop for six years. 

Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to expand the gold shop. He would add some more space to his shop, and would also improve the seating arrangement for customers. He would renovate his shop to attract more customers. He would also install some security cameras for the close monitoring of his shop. Sajida is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To add more space to her husband's gold shop.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 31-year-old married woman and  mother of two. She has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. Previously, she took a loan to purchase various goods of daily use that allowed her to fulfill the clients' demands more professionally and efficiently and she earned reasonable amount of profit to bear her household expenses.

Currently, she applied for a new loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to purchase stock of grains, rice and cleaning products including soaps and shampoos. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grains, rice and cleaning products, including soaps and shampoos.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 24 años, es madre soltera, y vive en su casa propia hecha de madera con su hija. Hace 3 años puso una tienda de productos comestibles en su hogar porque necesitaba estar al cuidado de su pequeña hija, es así como empezó con este negocio, actualmente se siente muy a gusto realizando esta actividad porque le gusta interactuar con sus clientes. Primitiva también compró una refrigeradora para empezar a vender bebidas heladas como refrescos y gaseosas, los cuales tienen una buena demanda porque vive en una zona tropical.
Cada mañana abre su negocio desde muy temprano y ofrece a sus clientes algunos productos como arroz, azúcar, cereales, conservas, fideos entre otros. Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es mejorar su vivienda y construirlo con ladrillos y cemento para mejorar su tienda. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con responsabilidad. Con el monto de  2,000 nuevo soles comprara mercadería para su negocio como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cereales, paquetes de gaseosa y golosinas.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 24 years old and a single mother. She lives with her daughter in her own house, made of wood. Three years ago, she opened a food store in her home because she needed to take care of her small daughter. That is how she started this business. Currently she enjoys running the business because she likes interacting with her customers. 

Primitiva also bought a refrigerator to begin selling cold drinks, such as soda pop, which are in high demand because she lives in a tropical zone. Each morning she opens her business very early and offers her customers products like rice, sugar, cereal, canned goods and noodles, among other items. 

One of her principal long term goals is to improve her dwelling and build it with bricks and cement in order to improve her store. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is committed to making her payments responsibly. With the sum of S/. 2,000 she will purchase merchandise for her business, such as bags of rice, sugar, cereals and boxes of soft drinks and candy.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store, such as rice and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Nofal

texts.en:
Nofal lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. Nofal manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Nofal is married and living with her child and husband in the family home.  Her child is just 2 1/2 years old.

Nofal joined Ruma 21 months ago because she believed joining with Ruma would be a great experience.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nofal sees improvements in her shop.  For the last three months, she earned an average of $150 - 155 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  Her goal for her business is to expand to more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Sabry

texts.en:
Sabry runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Sabry lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Sabry is single. 

Sabry began working with Ruma two years ago because he felt comfortable being Ruma’s partner. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $80 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To use as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Yusron

texts.en:
Yusron runs a small stall in which he sells clothes and mobile phone airtime credits. Yusron lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Yusron is married and lives with four people in the family home. 

Yusron began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to try a mobile airtime business. He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, he has around $70 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To use as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
