Ade lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. Ade manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Ade is married and living with his children and wife in the family home.  His children are just four years old and three months old.

Ade joined Ruma six months ago because he believed joining Ruma would be a great experience.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ade sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he earns an average of $100 - 101 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand to a new business in the future

loans.use: To use as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Toton

texts.en:
Toton lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. Toton manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Toton is single and living with six persons in the family home.  

Toton joined Ruma four months ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Toton sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $160 - 170 in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  His goal for his business is to expand to more new businesses in the future

loans.use: To use as working capital to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina, de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive desde hace dos años, en una casa alquilada. Conformó su familia, junto a su esposo Fortunato y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida con mucho cariño. Su principal actividad es el trasporte público, su esposo hace poco adquirió su propio auto, con el cual trabajan trasportando a los pasajeros que desean ir otras localidades , su trabajo es muy pesado pues existen días en las que realiza varios viajes los cuales duran muchas horas. “tengo que trabajar muy duro, sobre todo los días viernes que hay feria, pues los pobladores bajan a la ciudad”, afirma. Ahora desea cambiar el sistema de abastecimiento de su auto a uno ecológico como es el gas. Está segura de poder concretar este proyecto, ya que de esa manera podrá obtener mayores ingresos y su vehículo no sufrirá mucho desgaste. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante, por ello se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Celina, invertirá los S/.3500 en la conversión de su auto de petróleo a gas, de está manera podrá ahorrar más dinero, obtener más ganancias y conservar el planeta.
texts.en:
Celina is a hardworking woman of 38. She has lived for two years in her rented house. Her family is made up of herself, her husband, Fortunato, and her three children, who she cares for with much affection. Her principal work activity is public transport. Her husband recently acquired his own car, with which they transport passengers who want to go to other locations. Their work is very taxing; sometimes there are days when they make several trips that last many hours. "I have to work very hard, especially on Fridays when there is a fair, because people need to go down to the city," she says.

Now, she is hoping to change the fuel system in her car to an environmentally-friendly one: natural gas. She is certain that she will complete this project, because that way she will be able to earn a better income and her vehicle will not suffer much wear. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to help her get ahead. Because of this, she is committed to being on time with her payments.

Celina will invest the 3500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles in the conversion of her car from gasoline to natural gas. After this, she will be able to save up more money, earn a higher income, and preserve the planet.

loans.use: to convert her vehicle from gasoline to natural gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gold products to widen her inventory

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba has run an animal husbandry business for more than 15 years.  There are three people in her family, she lives with her husband and her one child. Her husband works as a builder and his salary is low. 

Since last year, Nasiba has been rebuilding her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. She needs to make a ceiling and floor, but she does not have enough money. The loan of 5,000 Somoni will go towards buying some missing building materials such as wood to finish rebuilding her family house.

loans.use: To buy wood to make a ceiling and floor for her new house

loans.name: Deysi Dolores

texts.es:
Deysi, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para incrementar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar concentrado para el ganado.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que incremento su ganadería aunque las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Deysi is requesting a new loan because she requires more working capital to increase her income and continue working in the same sector. The loan will allow her to buy food pellets for the livestock. 

The previous loan helped a lot since she was able to increase her herd even though her economic conditions and family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to buy food pellets for her cattle

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Geneviene is 25 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is single and she is a high school graduate. For the past five years she has been running a shop where she sells dresses and lappa (traditional cloths). She started this business by selling to her friends, which led her to establish her own business, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she meets new people all the time. She is requesting a loan to buy more drinks such as beer, shout, soft drinks, bottled water, etc. to increase her business. Her plans are to build another shop and buy a car. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as beer, shout, soft drinks, bottled water, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is 29 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities which is well-known in Liberia. She is unmarried and has four children aged between eight and three, who are presently in school and live at home. She completed grade 12. For the past six years she has been running a shop where she sells rice, oil, soap, flour, milk, sardines, etc. She joined this business because she was unfortunate and unable to continue her education. She started this business by selling on a market table which led to a provision shop, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she learned about those different kinds of local tribes. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, oil, soap, flour, milk, sardines, etc. to increase her business. Her plans are to open another shop and educate her children. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, soap, flour, milk, sardines, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito San Pablo Group

texts.es:
La señora Thelma Marilu de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 42 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 6 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, inició este negocio con un préstamo y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el poyo de su esposo quien se dedica a odontología.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capita de trabajo comprando mas mercadería para surtir la venta y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus cliente, en el futuro desea que su negocio sea grande generándole buenas ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Thelma Marilu has a partner.  She is 42 years old and completed primary school.  She has six children, four of whom are studying.  Thelma makes a living selling clothes for children.  She started this business with a loan and now has three years of experience.  She receives support from her husband, who is a dentist.

Thelma has organised a group and decided to apply for a loan in order to increase her working capital.  She will use this to buy more merchandise to stock up her business and satisfy her customers' needs.  In the future, Thelma would like her business to be big and generate good profits.  The other members of the group make a living selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyabandu est membre du groupe d’affaire  « Dunda mu Yesu », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est commerçant de divers. La cliente est sociétaire d’une quincaillerie. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Il y a 4 ans, elle fait ce petit commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 40 sacs de ciments. Les taxes et impôts divers, les impayés constituent un obstacle pour le développement de son entreprise. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Nyabandu is a member of the business group  « Dunda mu Yesu » and an experienced young entrepreneur, age 35, married and the mother of four children who are all in school. Her husband sells various items. She runs a hardware store. She started off in business with her own funds, money received from her husband. 

For four years now she has been in this small business. This new loan will allow her to buy 40 sacks of cement. Taxes and duties  and also customer debt constitute an obstacle in developing her little business. Thus, she would like to grow her working capital, to build a house, and nourish her children. Finally, she sincerely thanks Hekima for supporting small entrepreneurs with micro-loans. Please note that several of the group members are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of cement

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des mèches, des défrisants et des pommades, madame Akossiwa âgée de 30ans sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Après sa formation en coiffure, elle a ouvert en 2011 son atelier et n’éprouve aucune difficulté dans l’exécution de sa tache. A l’avenir, Akossiwa voudrait agrandir son activité et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille. Elle est mariée à un assistant médical et mère d’un enfant d’01an.
texts.en:
In order to purchase hair extensions, straightening products and hair treatments, 30 year old Akossiwa is seeking a first loan from WAGES. Following her hairdresser training, she opened her salon in 2011 and is trading without any apparent difficulty. In the future, Akossiwa would like to grow her business and to ensure a happy future for her family.
She is married to a medical assistant and is the mother of a one year old child.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages, des bijoux et sacs, madame Kayi âgée de 31ans sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Après sa formation en coiffure, elle a ouvert en 2009 son atelier et n’éprouve aucune difficulté dans l’exécution de sa tache. A l’avenir, Kayi voudrait agrandir son activité et assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille. Elle est mariée  et mère d’un enfant de 04ans qui va à l’école.
texts.en:
In order to buy two types of hair extensions, jewelry and bags, 31 year old Kayi is requesting a first loan from WAGES. Following her hairdresser training, she opened her salon in 2009 and is trading without any apparent difficulty.
In the future, she would like to grow her business, and to ensure a happy future for her family. She is married and is the mother of a four year old child, who attends school.

loans.use: to purchase two types of hair extensions, bags and other products.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de chaussures au grand marché, Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint mécanicien Auto et leurs enfants de 19 et 13ans scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins des clients, Akossiwa sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des chaussures. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
A shoe salesperson in the "Grand Marché", Akossiwa lives with her car mechanic partner and their two children - aged 19 and 13 and both in education. To meet the needs of her customers, Akossiwa is requesting a first loan with WAGES in order to purchase shoes.
As to the future, she would like to have additional sales outlets, and for her family to lead fulfilling lives.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Cimi

texts.es: Cimi, de 48 años, es una mujer buena y muy responsable, está casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les brinda mucho amor, actualmente vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo y sus pequeños luchando por salir adelante.El trabajo de Cimi consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo hace 16 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió trabajando desde joven como empleada de una señora que se dedicaba a este oficio, poco a poco y con mucha paciencia fue conociendo sobre técnicas de costura y decidió independizarse para generar sus propios ingresos poniendo en práctica todo lo que le enseñó su empleadora de aquel entonces. Actualmente forma parte de un taller de costura que estableció con una socia. Durante el tiempo que está dedicada a esta actividad siempre ha buscado la mejor forma para realizar su trabajo ya que muchas veces la presión de sus clientes la ha llevado a sentir que no iba a poder cumplir eficientemente su labor, sin embargo le hizo frente a las adversidades y actualmente tiene planes de expansión para su negocio, pero sabe que el camino para lograrlo es largo y por el momento desea mantenerlo como una meta a largo plazo, ahora se preparará para empezar a confeccionar sus propios diseños y venderlos ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles implementará su taller de costura comprando telas, agujas, hilos , entre otros para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Cimi is 48 years old.  She is a good person and very responsible.  She is married and has two children, whom she loves very much.  Cimi is currently living in a rented house, alongside her husband and young ones, and is fighting to move ahead in life.  Cimi mends and makes clothes.  She has a workshop in her home and has been doing this work for sixteen years.  She learned her trade from a young age, when she worked for another woman who was a seamstress.  Little by little, and with a lot of patience, Cimi learned the dressmaking skills and decided to work independently.  Putting the skills she had been taught by her previous employer into practice, Cimi was able to earn her own income.  Now Cimi has a workshop with a business partner.  In the time she has worked in this business, Cimi has always looked for the best way to her job.  On many occasions, pressure from customers has made Cimi feel that she was not going to complete the work efficiently.  However, she has faced her difficulties and now has plans to expand her business, though she knows that the path to this is long and so it is a long-term goal.  At the moment Cimi is preparing to start creating her own designs to sell, as she has orders from customers.  On this occasion, she is applying for 1500 Nuevo Soles and is very excited to learn that there are people who can provide her with financial support to continue developing her business.  Cimi promises to be responsible and make her repayments on time.  Cimi will use the loan to buy material, needles, thread and other supplies for her dressmaking workshop so as to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy material, threads, needles and other items.

loans.name: Rakhal

texts.en:
Rakhal is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is successfully doing a business selling milk with the support of her husband for the past fifteen years. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They have five calves and two milk cows. She milks cows then her husband sells the milk to the people of her community.  Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. 

Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Yaneth de estado civil soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, inició este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y hasta la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando mas pollos y en el futuro quiere tener un corral con mas pollos de los que tiene ahora. las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la fabricación de sueteres y pantalones, tambien a actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Mayra Yaneth is single.  She is 19 years old and completed all six years of her secondary education.  Mayra makes a living raising chickens.  She started the business with a small amount of savings and now has three years experience. She receives support from her family.

Mayra has organised a group and is applying for a loan to increase her working capital in order to buy more chickens.  In the future Mayra would like to have a poultry yard with more chickens.  The other members of the group work producing sweaters and trousers, as well as other business activities.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Akoeté

texts.fr: Akoeté est un homme de 31ans. Marié, il est père d’un enfant d’01an. Gérant d’une cafétéria, il achète les produits d’alimentation générale (spaghetti, lait, sucre, huile…) pour son cafétéria à Lomé. Son premier crédit l’aidera à acheter des marchandises. Monsieur Akoeté espère réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’avenir de sa famille. Il a une ancienneté de 04ans.
texts.en: Akoeté is a 31 year old married man. He is the father of a one year old child. Manager of a café, he buys various food products (spaghetti, milk, sugar, oil) for his café in Lomé. His first loan will help him to buy some supplies. Akoeté hopes to invest in his business and to ensure a future for his family. He has been in this role for four years now.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for his food outlet.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Âgée de 35ans, madame Améyo est veuve et maman d’01 enfant scolarisé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle revend du sodabi (boisson locale) à domicile. Son premier crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises afin d’acheter des marchandises pour répondre aux besoins des clients. Madame Améyo espère ouvrir une boutique et entretenir son enfant.
texts.en: Améyo is a 35 year old widow and the mother of one child, who attends school. To cover the family's living expenses, she sells 'sodabi' (a local alcoholic drink) from her home. Her first loan will allow her to buy supplies in order to meet the demand from her customers. Améyo hopes to open a small store and to care for her child.

loans.use: to purchase a local drink product.

loans.name: Goussi

texts.fr: Goussi vend du poulet et du maïs sur le marché. Mère de trois jeunes enfants,dont 02 scolarisés. Elle s’inquiète et veut à tout prix être capable de répondre à leurs besoins en termes de santé, d’alimentation et d’éducation. Sa demande de crédit est destinée à accroitre ses revenus grâce à l’ouverture de nouveaux points de vente. Elle exerce cette activité depuis maintenant 8 ans, et est certaine que cette évolution est nécessaire pour l’épanouissement de sa famille. Elle est mariée et âgée de 35ans.
texts.en: Goussi sells chickens and corn in the market. She is the mother of three young children, two of whom attend school. She is anxious to ensure at all costs that she is able to meet their needs in terms of health, nutrition and education. Her loan request is made with a view to growing her turnover, with the opening of additional sales outlets. She has been doing this business for eight years now, and is convinced that this next step is necessary for the family's wellbeing. She is married and 35 years old.

loans.use: to buy chickens and corn.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been happily doing business of selling milk for the past six years. She has two buffalos that provide milk, which she sells to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for about nine years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons. In this way she will be able to generate a healthier source of income and set aside some savings for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Aqsa

texts.en: Aqsa is a 23-year-old married woman. One year ago she started her own business selling bed sheets to contribute to her family income. Her husband is a laborer but his income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family. Aqsa buys bundles of bed covers and blankets from the market then sells to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She earns enough to have a decent life. She wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demand of her customers, but due to lack of availability of funds she is not able to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy more bed covers and blankets in different colors and designs. She expects a boost in her earnings with this loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers and blankets in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A 36 ans, Afi est vendeuse de pagnes et autres vêtements en livraison depuis maintenant trois ans. Elle souhaite avoir des revenus plus stables afin d’assurer la scolarisation de ses deux jeunes enfants. Elle envisage ainsi de quitter la vente ambulante pour ouvrir une véritable boutique, mais a pour cela besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter dans un premier temps ses ventes et pouvoir acheter à terme un local.
texts.en: 36 years of age, Afi has been a seller of traditional woven outfits and other special-order clothing for three years now. She wants to have a more stable income in order to cover the education costs of her two young children. She plans therefore to stop her mobile selling, in order to open a real store - for that she needs a loan, in order first to grow her sales, and then to be able to be able to buy a place in due course.

loans.use: to purchase traditional outfits, some damask and various other items.

loans.name: Moussodjeton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  MOUSSODJETON  3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à DJALAKORO, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5 eme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide à l'image de Awa , 2 eme personne  de la droite vers la gauche, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 12.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the MOUSSODJETON 3 group are married women with an average age of 35. They each have on average four children, and all live in traditional families in Djalakoro, one of the villages in San, the fourth largest administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to do their agricultural work during the winter season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, the previous loans having all been repaid. 
The crop grown is the peanut in the case of Awa, the second person in from the right on the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy soil inputs, seeds and small farming equipment, and to pay the costs of ploughing the 0.5 hectare plot. The crop will be sold, following the harvest, in the village and in San, to both men and women customers.
She plans to make a profit of 12,000 FCFA per harvest. This profit will allow her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soil inputs, seeds and small farming tools, and to pay for ploughing.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 27-year-old married woman. She has had a carpet manufacturing business for many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the picture is her husband. They offer various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and make enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, Sajida contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. It’s her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta is a 28-year-old woman who lives in Long Town, one of the early well-known communities in Liberia. She lives there with her fiance and three children,  two who are in school. She has been running a provision shop where they sell rice, soda, soap, milk, batteries, soft drinks, oil, mineral water and others items. She says her business enables her to send her children to school. Loretta says that she started this business by selling from a table market in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, soda, soap, milk, battery, soft drinks, oil, mineral water and others items for her business. Her plans are to open another shop, and in the future, to see her children out of high school and attending college.

loans.use: to buy more rice, soda, soap, milk, batteries and others items for her business.

loans.name: Madia

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Madia from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 
She completed 12 grades at school and is married.  Her husband sells fashion clothes. She has four children between the ages of 23 and 7.  Three are in school and they all live at home. Madia had had her own business selling bags of rice for the past three years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more bags of rice for her business.  On average, she works 10 hours every day at her business.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by bus.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers.  In the future, she would like to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: A 50 ans, Amavi est très active et vend du charbon  et du maïs sur les marchés. Avec son mari, qui travaille au port, elle souhaite renforcer son activité pour assurer la bonne santé et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle a pour cela besoin d’un prêt pour lui permettre d’acheter davantage de stock, pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients et donc disposer de revenus plus stables.
texts.en: At fifty years of age, Amavi is very active and sells sacks of charcoal and corn on various markets. Together with her husband, who works at the port, she wants to strengthen her business to ensure the good health and education of her children. Thus she needs a loan to allow her to buy more stock, to better meet the needs of her customers and therefore to obtain a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and corn.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou est photographe professionnel et revendeur de matériel photographique. A 28 ans, il envisage de fonder une famille mais souhaite tout d’abord accroitre ses revenus afin d’être certains de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but d’agrandir ses points de vente, il voudrait obtenir un premier crédit à WAGES qui lui permettrait d’augmenter ses stocks de matériel pour mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en: Kokou is a professional photographer and seller of photographic material. At 28 years of age, he is thinking about starting a family but would first like to increase his income in order ensure his self-sufficiency. With a view to expanding his sales outlets, he would like to get a loan from WAGES which will allow him to increase his inventory of material so that he can better fulfill his customer demand.

loans.use: to buy photographic products.

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard is from Khndzoresk village, which is one of the beautiful and historical places in Armenia. Locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding. Nvard lives with her husband and they breed cattle. Their livestock currently includes 20 cows and 15 calves. Nvard also owns a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. Although both Nvard and her husband are retired, they work really hard to run their farm and get income from it. 
By requesting this loan, Nvard wants to purchase a cow as well as fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. The loan is very important for Nvard to be able to continue the expansion of her farm and gather more income. 
She waits for your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cover fuel costs

loans.name: Carmen Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  de 45 años de edad es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación y se dedica la elaboración y venta de rosquias desde hace 3 años.
Doña Carmen su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante  y sale a vender su producto a las comunidades cercanas, elabora todo tipo de pan como hojaldras, pan de pan, rosquillas etc. está  muy contenta por el apoyo qué se le va a brindar.
Doña Carmen  tiene muchos clientes que le compran sus productos y le demandan cada vez más, le prefieren por sus ricas rosquillas.
Doña Carmen  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como maíz, cuajada, leche, azúcar, harina, aceite, café, etc. Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante y seguir mejorando su negocio.
Doña Carmen su sueño es mejorar más su negocio y  tener el negocio más fuerte de la comunidad.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Carmen, 45, is married and lives with her husband. She has been making and selling rosquillas [ring-shaped snacks made with corn and cheese] for three years. Carmen works as a street vendor. She visits nearby communities and makes all kinds of bakery products, such as puff pastry, bread, rosquillas, etc. She feels happy for the support she is about to receive. Carmen has many customers that buy her products and demand every time more from her, since they prefer her delicious rosquillas.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as corn, curd, milk, sugar, flour, oil and coffee. With the support she receives through this loan and the profits from her business, she will get ahead and her business will improve. Carmen’s dream is to improve her business and turn it into the strongest business in town.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn, curd, milk, sugar, flour and coffee for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Djollo Kagoua, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est :l’arachide  avec  DJENEBA, 1 ere  femme debout de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits materiels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 25.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 5 children, who all live in traditional families in Djollo Kagoua, one of the villages of San, the 4th administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 5th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Djeneba, standing on the left in the picture, grows groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the labourers needed for the cultivation of half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in San, to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to have made a profit of 25 000 francs by the end of the season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay labour fees and buy agricultural inputs, small equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Reussite Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAWA représente le groupe  REUSSITE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. Un va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend friperies depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes Italiens et dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter une (01) balle de friperies.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte d’épargne afin d’épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de friperies et acquérir sa propre cour d’habitation car elle est en location.
texts.en: Hawa represents the group "Reussite". She is married and the mother of 2 children. The eldest is 22 years old and the youngest, 15. One of her children goes to school and she is responsible for 3 people. She has been selling second-hand clothing for 3 years. She gets her supplies from Italian wholesalers and at her local market. Her customers are men, women and children. She would like to buy one bale of second-hand clothing. She wants to open a savings account so that she can save her profits. She aims to open a second-hand clothes shop and to buy her own home, as she is currently renting.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The business woman taking this SME loan is a 39 years old Iraqi woman who has asked to remain anonymous. She lives in north Iraq with her family - her husband and two children. She is employed by the Ministry of Education and is now opening a new, private therapeutic center for children with mental health problems and physical disabilities. She would like to specifically focus on children with autism but with high demand from others she will try to work with as many children as possible.   

She employs a unique therapist, a woman who finished her education with a Masters of Physiotherapy in orthopedics in India and although the four room facility is not yet fully finished, there is already a list of children who will be attending the facility for development programs. The facility is located in an easily accessible building in the area of the bazaar that has all the private medical businesses and pharmacies. 

Her business activity is registered by the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of her city. She is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to buy more of the required therapeutic equipment and materials for the facility.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for the children's therapeutic center

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is running a gas station in the area of New Kru Town where she lives. She has run this business for the past seven years and makes lots of profit since she is the only female who sells gasoline in her community. The profits are used for house rent, school fees, and to increase her savings. One of the problems she faces is the road condition and cost of transporting the product to her gas station. She started this business with ten gallons of gasoline in front of her yard as she lives close to the road. The money to start the business was given to her by her late father who was also selling gas. She is requesting a loan to buy more gasoline for her business. She has three children aged between 9 and 11, all of whom are in school and live at home. Deborah is 29 years old, and a high school graduate. Her plan is to expand her business by opening another branch. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 54-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and two daughters. Her husband has been running a tyre shop for two years. Safia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase new tyres to sell and this would increase his net income and savings. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase new tyres to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He is from Lebanon and has owned a car repair shop since 2009. His job consists of changing the oil in cars. With his requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, he will increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies such as oils, screwdrivers and hammers. He took advantage of a previous Kiva loan and he was very satisfied with the results especially that he was able to remarkably expand his business and get a higher income. In the future, he plans to open a new branch of his shop where he will start car spare parts sales in addition to his area of expertise.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory of mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan continua viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y con la carpintería pues tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, camas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más, él continua también con la venta de leña en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juan  requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero y clavos. 

Juan continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan continues living in the city of Huancarani and running his small carpenty workshop in his home where he makes all types of furniture, such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, tables and other things.  He also continues to sell firewood from home.  

On this occasion, Juan is requesting a loan to buy more work materials such as wood, carpinter's glue and nails.

He is still a member of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" of the Arariwa Association.  He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more work materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business

loans.name: Lissette Magdalena

texts.es:
Lissette tiene 25 años de edad de estado soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la VRC GENESIS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto atascoso, Pertenece al Cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Lissette se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar urea, semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la bomba para fumigar los sembríos.  

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en Guaranda. El desafío a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y enfermedades en las siembras.

El sueño es ponerse un negocio de comida. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Lissette, 25, is single she and her three children live in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She belongs to the communal bank "GENESIS" which is located in the Atascoso community in Ventanas, where agriculture and livestock farming are predominant.

Lissette is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She is requesting a loan to buy urea, seeds and fertilizers.  The loan will also help her buy a fumigation pump for the crops.

Guaranda is where she buys and sells her products.  The challenges she faces include crop diseases and plagues.

Her goal is to open a food business in the future.  In her free time she enjoys being with her children.

loans.use: To buy urea, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: El Sr. Wilson sigue con la misma actividad de confección de ropa deportiva, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de una maquina over para la confección de prendas de vestir,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela al por mayor y cierres para confeccionar prendas ya que tiene pedidos de  instituciones así que quiere abastecerse de este producto y así generar más ingresos esta época.
texts.en: Wilson continues in the same business, making sports clothing.  He says that his previous loan worked out well because he used it to buy an overlock machine for making clothing.  On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to buy fabric wholesale as well as clothes fasteners.  He has orders from institutions and would like to stock up with these products so that he can make more income this season.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making sports clothing

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She has had a business of making artificial flowers for the past twenty years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used in decorating homes and rooms. She has become famous for providing good quality colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her second loan cycle and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. This will help her to purchase raw material including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton, as well as packs of glues, papers and wires. In this way she will be able to increase her earnings through her improved sales.

loans.use: to purchase raw material including various types of fabrics such as silk and cotton, as well as packs of glues, papers and wires.

loans.name: Dunia Azucena

texts.es:
Dunia es una joven de 24 años de edad, casada y madre de una hija de 2 años con un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el tercer grado de educación primaria. En compañía de su esposo siendo el su único apoyo trabajan la agricultura hace más de 3 años pero fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a cultivar café y banano ya que esta actividad ha sido su único ingreso económico para sus padres y hoy en día para su familia. Las tierras que trabajan son propias gracias a la preferencia de los clientes al consumir su producto y al esfuerzo por varios años de trabajo las cuales están ubicadas a 50 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café comprando materiales como: fertilizantes, abono, urea, entre otros. 

Sus planes son poder seguir trabajando para comprar un poco más de tierra y extender sus cultivos de café y sembrar una variedad de productos con los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad y atraer más clientes. Su sueño como madre es ver crecer a su hija para brindarle todo el apoyo necesario posible y que ella pueda alcanzar sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Dunia, 24, is married and has a two-year-old daughter.  She has a third grade education and works with her husband in agriculture which she has been doing for three years.  Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow coffee and bananas since this was their only source of income and still is for the family.  The farmland is their own after many years of hard work and because of the popularity of their crop.  The land is 50 meters away from home and they walk there every day to care for and maintain the crops.

Dunia is requesting a loan through the COMIXMUL co-operative in order to provide maintenance and care for her coffee crops.  She will buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea and other items.

Her goal is to continue working so she can buy more land and expand her coffee plantation.  She wants to plant a variety of products to attract more customers.  As a mother, her dream is to see her daughter grow up with everything she needs so she can reach her goals and realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy maintenance supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es: El señor Darío es una persona trabajadora y responsable vive con su pareja en la población de Valle Sacta y tienen un lote agrícola en el cual trabaja para mantener a sus dos hijos, tiene plantaciones de naranja, plátano y yuca pero no le abastece como para poder subsistir y prosperar o para que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida que la de él,  por tal motivo el señor solicita préstamo para poder ampliar sus cítricos y así tener un poco más de ingresos económicos, además que a sus hijos no les falte nada para que puedan estudiar sin preocupaciones, y así tal vez en algún momento puedan sus hijos ser unos buenos profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en: Darío is a hard-working, responsible person who lives with his partner in the town of Valle Sacta.  They have a plot of farmland where he works to support their two children.  Darío has orange, banana and cassava fields but they don't provide enough for him to survive and prosper or for his children to enjoy a better life than he did.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can expand his citrus fruit plantings and thereby make a little more income.  He doesn't want his children to lack anything and wants them to be able to study without having to worry so that, in the future, they can become successful professionals.

loans.use: to expand his citrus fruit plantings

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas San Pablo Group

texts.es:
La señora Aura Marina es madre soltera, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio vende ropa para caballeros y niños, inició este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia; ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Ella decide organizar un grupo para realizar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar mecadería como: sueteres, pantalones, calcetines, camisas entre otros para que su negocio sea grande y con variedad, en el futuro quiere tener un local grande donde las personas puedan conseguir de todo en ropa para caballeros y niños; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a venta de ropa clasificada.
texts.en:
Aura Marina, 35, is a single mother with a primary school education.  She has three chidlren, two of whom are students, and she sells men's and children's clothing for a living.  She began her business with a small amount of savings and so far has four year's experience; and she receives the support of her family.

Aura Marina decided to organize a group to request a loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, pants, socks, shirts and other items to increase the variety of her business.  In the future she wants to have a large stall where people can find everything they are looking for in men's and children's clothing.  The other members of the group sell different kinds of clothing.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio vive en la ciudad de Huancarani donde realiza sus actividades familiares y económicas pues él continua con la carpintería  pues es un maestro bien reconocido en la ciudad, él continua con el pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más. Y en esta oportunidad Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cola, maderas y clavos.

Claudio continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudio lives in the city of Huancarani where he works and has a family.  He works in carpentry and is also a well-known teacher in the city.  He has a small shop in his home where he makes a variety of wood furniture such as tables, chairs, doors, beds, and others. Currently, Claudio needs a loan so that he can buy materials such as glue, wood, and nails.

Claudio is part of the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" in the Arariwa association.  He is thankful for this opportunity and he also promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work such as glue, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Eva Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Eva tiene 44 años,  su actividad económica es venta frutas según a la temporada, se dedica a esta actividad hace 20 años, el destino del crédito es para la compra fruta de la temporada por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, la Sra. Eva es una persona trabajadora, ya que esta es única fuente de ingresos, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, ella tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Chasquipampa en uno de los mercados de la zona, el deseo de la Sra. Eva es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos como también incrementar su clientela para generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Eva is 44 years old and she sells fruit according to the season.  She has worked in this job for 20 years.  She will use this loan so that she can buy seasonal fruit to sell from her sales location.  Eva is a hard-working person and this is her only source of income.  She is thankful to the institution for the support they have given her. 

Eva has her own sales location in the region of Chasquipampa, in one of the central marketplaces of the area.  She hopes to one day have a store where she can offer a variety of projects so that she can increase the number of her customers and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en concubinato con María tienen dos hijos, a los que ayudan en sus estudios y alimentación, para  ello necesitan mucha ayuda económica, actualmente trabajan en un chaco que le otorgaron sus padres,  tienen plantaciones de piña y yuca, ellos se levantan muy temprano para realizar sus actividad laboral, tienen sueños de ampliar sus cultivos y así tendrán mayores  ingresos, Roger y María  no pudieron continuar con sus estudios por motivo problemas familiares. El señor Roger  solicita un crédito para compra de hijuelos de piña, de esta manera ampliaran su producción y mejoraran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roger, 23, lives with his common-law wife, María, and they have two children who they care for and educate, which is why they need financial support.  Currently they work on land given them by their parents, where they grow pineapple and yucca plant.  They get up very early to go off to work; and their goal is to expand the plantation in an effort to increase their income.

Roger and María were unable to continue their education due to family problems.  Roger is requesting a loan to buy pineapple plantlings so he can increase production and improve his income.

loans.use: To buy pineapple plantlings.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina de 30 años de edad es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora, con mucha vida y salud la cual es madre solera de 3 hijos a los cuales apoya y respeta muchos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el segundo grado por lo que ella no pudo continuar estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres mismos que desde pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que es una tradición familiar y su único medio de ingreso económico. La tierra que ella trabaja en compañía de su familia es propia y está ubicada a una distancia de 50 metros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada a pie diariamente.  Ella encuentra como su único desafió la baja de los precios en temporadas, los problemas con los cambios climáticos pero sobre todo los problemas de plagas en sus cultivos de no ser tratados a tiempo.

Es por ello que ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero con el cual ella podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, urea, gramoxon entre otros que mantendrán su cultivo con un buen follaje, un buen color y libre de plagas.    

Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre de familia es ver a sus hijos graduados a nivel profesional para que puedan mejorar su estilo de vida, sus conocimientos y puedan enfrentar los problemas económicos de manera favorable con un patrimonio fortalecido.
texts.en:
30-year-old Reina is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman who is full of life and good health.  She is the single mother of three children who she supports and takes care of.  Reina did not complete her own primary education.  She only studied up to the second year then had to stop because her parents were unable to support her financially.  When she was a little girl, Reina's parents taught her to work the land as that was their family tradition and the only way they had of making income.  Reina owns the land that she and her family currently work.  It is located just 50 meters from her home and she walks there every day.  The only challenges she faces are seasonal price fluctuations, changes in the weather and pests damaging her crops if she doesn't manage to deal with them in a timely manner.  

Reina has requested financial support from COMIXMUL to buy fertilizers, manure, urea, Gramoxon and other supplies that she needs to keep her crops free of pests, with good foliage and good color.

Reina's dreams and future plans as a mother are to see her children graduate and become professionals so that they can improve their lifestyle and their skills and successfully face any financial problems that may arise with a strong inheritance behind them.

loans.use: to buy supplies for protecting and maintaining her coffee crops

loans.name: Susy Ines

texts.es: La Sra. Susy  sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de distintos productos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de frazadas y edredones al por mayor,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de edredones por mayor ya que tiene mucho pedido de este producto debido al intenso frio ya que es época de invierno, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Susy continues doing the same work, which is the sale of various products for the home.  She says that everything went very well with the previous loan, which she used to buy wholesale blankets and quilts.  She is now seeking a loan for the purchase of wholesale quilts.  She has already received a lot of orders for them because this winter is meant to be even colder than last year.  She is happy and thankful for this opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale quilts.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Doña teresa (a la mitad de la fotografía) una mujer de 57 años de edad ella esta en unión simple con su esposo y vive en Sololá.  Junto a su esposo y sus 7 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando en la escuela se apoyan para contribuir a la economía de la familia.
Ella se dedica a la fabricación de figuras de diferentes clases en hilos que se utilizan en los trajes típicos femeninos que  usan en su comunidad la cual se le llama (jaspeado). Ella aprendió hace unos años a realizar este trabajo con algunas personas donde trabajo un tiempo.
Ella es independiente trabajando con su propio capital desde hace 2 años viendo ella que su ganancia es buena y quiere seguir invirtiendo capital para seguir fabricando este tipo de producto.
Ella es la  representante de este grupo solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio. Comprando hilos y tintes que utilizara, las demás integrantes (las dos de cada lado de la fotografía) son socias y se dedica a la c/v de ropa casual utilizando también una parte de este crédito comprando más ropa variada  y ampliar esta venta.
Las tres señoras tienen una meta de seguir invirtiendo y tener un negocio más grande en un futuro teniendo mejores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en: Teresa (in the center of the photo) is a 57-year-old woman who lives with her husband in Sololá. She and her husband have seven children, one of whom is still in school, and they both contribute financially toward supporting their family. Teresa's business is producing woven ikat fabric which is used to make the traditional women's skirts that people in her community wear. She learned this work a number of years ago from some people she used to work with. Teresa has been working independently with her own capital for two years. As she makes good profits, she would like to continue investing capital in her business so that she can continue producing this type of fabric. Teresa is the representative of her group and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will buy yarn and dyes to use in her work. The other members of the group (the two women on either side of Teresa in the photo) have businesses buying and selling casual clothing. Some of this loan will be used to buy a wider range of clothing and increase sales. These three ladies have a common goal: to continue investing so that their business become larger in the future and they can make more income for their families.

loans.use: to buy yarn and dyes for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 59 años,  tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de 18 años, el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles de cocina,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 30 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Carlos  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera para la construcción de puertas ya que tiene un pedido, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar puertas,  el Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carlos is 59 years old and has four children who are all over the age of 18.  His business is making doors and kitchen cabinets and his carpentry workshop is located in Plan 3000 district, in the city of Santa Cruz.  He has been in this business for 30 years now, having learned it from his father who was also a carpenter.  This loan is Carlos' first from the institution.  He will use it to buy wood for making doors as he currently has an order to fill.  He is requesting this loan as he lacks the capital he needs to buy these work materials.  Without it, he would be unable to make his doors.  Carlos faces challenges in his business such as working his way out of poverty.  He will use the profits he makes to improve his quality of life as this is the only work he has with which to provide for himself and his family.  He feels happy and is grateful to the institution for the support they are providing.

loans.use: to buy wood for making doors

loans.name: Yuvis

texts.es: Yuvis, de 32 años, está casada, y vive en su  casa propia junto su esposo y su hijo. Yuvis se dedica a la compra y venta de motos y mototaxis usados,la venta la realiza desde su hogar. Empezó su negocio hace más de 4 años con la ayuda de su esposo. También trabaja en una empresa privada, de esta manera obtiene varios ingresos. Le gusta su actividad puesto que puede ayudar con los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo dejar que su hijo reciba una buena educación. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo y así formar una tienda para la venta de motos de primera y segunda calidad. Este es el cuarto préstamo con Kiva. Yuvis compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Con el monto de 4000 nuevos soles, comprara los repuestos para sus motos ya que necesitan mantenimiento.
texts.en: Yuvis is 32 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and son. Yuvis buys and sells used motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. She does the sales from her home. She started her business more than 4 years ago with her husband's help. She also works at a private company, and gets other income that way. She likes this activity because she can help with the household expenses and at the same time let her son get a good education. She has plans to keep growing and then open a store to sell first and second class motorcycles. This is her fourth loan with Kiva. Yuvis is committed to making her payments on time, like she did with previous loans. With the amount of 4000 nuevos soles, she will buy the replacement parts for her motorcycles, since they need maintenance.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her motorcycles because they need maintenance.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximilina, de 46 años , está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Maximilina se dedica a la venta de comidas, la venta la realiza  afuera de su hogar, sus clientes son  mayormente sus vecinos, y además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, lleva en este negocio un promedio de 5 años. Le gusta su negocio porque le ha dado el poder económico para ayudar con gastos de su hogar. Ha tenido problemas al principio pero ahora ella realiza mejor los cálculos de sus ventas para así comprar lo necesario. Esto es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Con el monto de 3000 nuevos soles, comprara los ingredientes necesarios para la venta de sus comidas tales como harina, azúcar, limones, entre otros.
texts.en:
46-year-old Maximilina is married and lives in her own home together with her husband and their four children.  Her business is selling food.  She makes her sales outside her home and her customers are mainly neighbors.  She also has the support of her husband.  Maximilina has been in her business for around 5 years.  She likes it because it has enabled her to help out financially with the household expenses.

This is Maximilina's first loan from Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving.  She will use her 3,000 soles to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and lemons which she needs to make the food she sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as flour and sugar, to make the food she sells

loans.name: Buenas Emprendedoras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento BUENAS EMPRENDEDORAS – 26 está compuesta por once  integrantes de los cuales siete  son mujeres y cuatro  varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la  Sra. Jimena, tiene 39 años, y cuatro hijos de las edades de 19, 12, 4 y 1 año, ella se dedica a la venta de celulares en su puesto de venta que se encuentra zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Jimena va a utilizar  este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería celulares por mayor para surtir su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, la  Sra. Jimena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una buena venta y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería para seguir mejorando su negocio y así de esta manera seguir generando más ingresos y por ende  mejorar su calidad de vida, la  Sra. Jimena se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The BUENAS EMPRENDEDORAS – 26 communal bank is made up of eleven members, of which seven are women and four are men. They work in different activities. The president of the bank is Jimena. She is 39 years old, and has four children aged 19, 12, 4 and 1. She works selling cell phones in her sales spot in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto. This loan is her second cycle in the institution. Jimena is going to use this loan to buy merchandise wholesale, such as cell phones, to stock her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her working capital. Jimena faces challenges in her business such as having good sales. She is going to use the profits to keep buying merchandise to keep improving her business and thus keep generating more income and improving her quality of life. Jimena is happy and grateful for the opportunity that is being given to her the other group members.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories wholesale.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor  Pablo de 69  años  de edad es casado,  vive con su esposa  y un nieto en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 20  años al negocio de venta de hamacas y lazos de forma ambulante, el compra la mercadería en y la revende en las pulperías y en los lugares fuera de la ciudad.
Don Pablo también vende frescos, agua y otros productos en su casa con el apoyo de su esposa.
Don Pablo está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos de botella, lazos y hamacas, con el apoyo del préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio y también sus ingresos, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su séptimo préstamo que solicita.
Don Pablo su sueño es mejorar su casa..
	
San Lorenzo, Honduras- Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
69-year-old Pablo is married and lives with his wife and grandson in his own home.  For the past 20 years, he has been selling hammocks and hammock ropes as a traveling salesman.  He buys his merchandise and then re-sells it in convenience stores and other places outside the city.  Pablo also sells soft drinks, water and other products from his home with his wife's help.

Pablo is requesting a loan to buy bottled [soft] drinks, hammocks and hammock ropes.  With the support of this loan, he plans to improve his business and his income.  He is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  This is his seventh loan request.

Pablo's dream is to make improvements to his home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: to buy bottled [soft] drinks, hammocks and hammock ropes for his business

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
El Joven Wilmer de 24 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa de habitación en una  colonia  de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05  años a la venta de arroz, frijoles, huevos, espaguetis, pollo, carne, chuleta,  manteca entre otros.
Wilmer su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan.
Wilmer está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su pulpería como ser: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, huevos, carnes, manteca, café, pastas, etc. ya que necesita tener un mayor surtido por que tiene bastante clientela.
Wilmer  espera poder obtener más ganancias en su negocio con esta inversión y su sueño es ampliar más su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2013.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young man of 24.  He lives with his wife and children in his own home which is located in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.  For the past five years, Wilmer has been selling rice, beans, eggs, spaghetti, chicken, meat, chops, butter and other goods.

Wilmer's business is located in his home and his customers are friends and neighbors who visit him every day.  He is requesting this loan to buy more goods for his convenience store such as beans, sugar, rice, eggs, meat, butter, coffee, pasta, etc.  He needs more stock because he has a lot of customers.

As a result of this investment, Wilmer hopes to be able to make more profits from his business.  His dream is to further expand his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, eggs, meat, butter, coffee, pasta, etc. for his business

loans.name: Ana Azucena

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Leon, madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica a elaborar y vender cosa de horno ( pan hecho de maíz, canela, azúcar), lleva  4 años dedicándose al comercio. Su primera experiencia  como comerciante fue vendiendo tortillas, luego empezó a elaborar cosa de horno, su madre le enseño a preparar y darle ese sabor especial. Poco a poco ha captado clientela parte de la producción la vende en su casa y la otra parte la distribuye de manera ambulante, así es como lleva ingresos para mantener a su familia. 
Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar maíz, queso, canela y leña. Pues es parte de la materia prima que necesita para elaborar su producto. Uno de sus planes futuros es tener un horno más grande y ahorrar para tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old. She lives in the city of Leon and is the mother of 2 children, aged 3 and 6. She works making and selling cosa de horno (bread made from corn, cinnamon and sugar). She has been doing this for 4 years. Her first experience as a merchant was selling tortillas. Later she started to make cosa de horno. Her mother taught her how to prepare it and give it that special flavor. Little by little, she has gained customers. Part of what she makes she sells from her home and the other part is distributed by street vending. That is how she brings in income to support he family. 

Today she is asking for the loan to buy corn, cheese, cinnamon and firewood. This is part of the raw materials she needs to make her product. One of her plans for the future is to have a bigger oven and save up to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, cinnamon and firewood.

loans.name: Glondy Yassira

texts.es: La Sra. Glondy  tiene 21 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Glondy  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Glondy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Glondy  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: Glondy is 21 years old and her business is selling seasonal clothing.  She sells her products from her sales location in the town of El Torno.  This loan is her first from the institution.  She will use it to buy clothing such as sweaters and jackets wholesale in order to stock her business as the cold season is approaching and she makes a lot of sales and even receives orders at that time of year.  She is requesting this loan as she lacks capital.  Glondy faces challenges in her business such as daily competition.  She will use the profits she makes to buy electrical appliances for her home.  Her business plan is to have more merchandise in stock so that she can offer her customers a wider range of products.  Glondy feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they are providing as it allows her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as sweaters and jackets wholesale

loans.name: Lindis

texts.es: Lindis, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, decidida y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Misael quien es comerciante y padre de sus 4 hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja e hijos en la comodidad de su casa propia. Lindis se dedica a la venta de zapatos y zapatillas de marcas reconocidas. Ofrece todo tipo de calzados para varones y damas de diferentes tallas y modelos y a precios cómodos. Desarrolla esta actividad hace 1 año y afirma que le está yendo muy bien. Trabaja sola y realiza sus ventas de acuerdo a los pedidos que le soliciten sus clientes con anticipación o visitando a sus amigos de forma rutinaria. Vende al contando aunque por lo general todo lo deja a crédito y realiza la cobranza en fechas pactadas con el cliente. Se siente a gusto realizando su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo se retribuye con las buenas ganancias que logra recibir, asegura que necesita de un préstamo mayor ya que quiere incrementar sus productos debido a la temporada de verano que ya se aproxima, su principal objetivo es incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que obtiene para que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará cierta cantidad de zapatos y zapatillas de marcas reconocidas para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
38-year-old Lindis is a hard-working, determined woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She is married to Misael who sells goods for a living and is the father of her four children.  Lindis lives with her husband and children in the comfort of her own home.  Her business is selling well-known brands of shoes and sneakers.  She sells all kinds of men's and women's footwear in different sizes and designs, at affordable prices.  She has been in this business for one year and confirms that it is doing very well.  Lindis works alone and makes her sales according to the orders that she receives from her customers.  These orders are either placed in advance or she receives them by routinely visiting her friends.  Lindis requests payment in cash although she generally leaves her goods on credit and collects payment on dates that she agrees in advance with her customers.  She feels happy in her work as her hard work pays off in the good profits that she is able to make.  She needs a larger loan because she would like to increase her quantity of goods.  The summer season is approaching and her main goal is to increase her quantity of merchandise so that she can sell a wider range of goods to her customers.

On this occasion, Lindis is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving as it will help her to realize her business plans.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy a certain quantity of branded shoes and sneakers so that she can continue making sales.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sneakers for her business

loans.name: Flamme De Dilaire 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Dieudonne est le coordinatrice de son groupe Flamme de Dilaire. Elle est mariée, elle  a 4  enfants. Dieudonne habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee.
